This is in response to conditions prevailing in Puerto Rico during World War II. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt of this document, as it is primarily a practical measure to address an emergency situation. It does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It could be seen as interventionist in the economy, as it allows for loans to be made without regard to the usual limitations. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
